subject: Gardening
title: Garden Rooms: Dividing Space
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Garden Rooms: Dividing Space.

hook.text: Sissinghurst Castle has a small garden that feels enormous. The secret: it's divided into separate outdoor rooms.

buildup.text: Garden rooms use hedges, walls, or changes in level to create distinct areas, each with its own character and purpose.

discovery.text: Dividing a garden makes it feel larger. You can't see the whole space at onceâ€”so each room contains a surprise.

twist.text: Doorways between rooms control the sequence of experience. You choreograph what visitors seeâ€”and when they see it.

climax.text: Garden rooms turn a flat plot into a journey. Every opening is a reveal, every threshold a new beginning.

punchline.text: Divide a small garden and it feels twice as large.

quiz.question: Why do garden rooms make a small space feel larger?
options: Tall hedges cast more shade, making the ground appear to stretch further
You can't see the whole space at once, so each room adds a surprise
The additional walls and hedges physically expand the garden's perimeter
